summary: This document is a series of email exchanges from August 4, 2019, between staff at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, discussing staffing shortages, modified operations, and the designation of an acting captain. The context references heightened security concerns 'due to Epstein' and mentions vacated housing units.

events.title: Modified Status and Staffing Shortages at MCC
events.description: The MCC is on modified operational status with significant staffing shortages, including 13 vacant posts and vacated housing units (SHU 3 and 4, 5 south, 7 south). Heightened concerns are noted, partly 'due to Epstein'.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The email exchange occurs on August 4, 2019, just days before Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody on August 10, 2019.

The Metropolitan Correctional Center is operating under a 'modified status' with severe staffing shortages, including 13 vacant posts and specific housing units (SHU 3 and 4, 5 south, 7 south) being vacated.
A staff member explicitly states that security concerns are heightened, noting 'Not only due to Epstein but one of the reasons,' directly linking the operational changes to Epstein's presence.
The document shows internal confusion and communication issues, with a designated acting captain (Lt.) initially unaware of their assignment for the weekend.
The correspondence is marked 'CONFIDENTIAL' and is part of the SDNY document production (SDNY_00012402, EFTA00139876).
